segments.text: Oh no, look at that sink—water everywhere from the overflow.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's just standing there, polishing her plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's oblivious to the puddle spreading under her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That could be so dangerous if she slips on the wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids— the boy is way up on that shaky stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's grabbing cookies from the jar, but one wrong move and he'll fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting, her little hand stretched out eagerly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for them; they're going to get hurt if no one stops this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and dishes are stacked nearby.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden is calm, like a picture of perfection.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's heartbreaking how unaware the mom is of all this trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to turn off that faucet before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is tense, waiting for disaster to strike.
segments.speaker: PAR
